title: Vector leptoquark contributions to lepton dipole moments
authors:
Arvind Bhaskar, Diganta Das, Soumyadip Kundu, Anirudhan A. Madathil,
  Tanumoy Mandal, Subhadip Mitra
abstract:
Leptoquarks (LQs) can contribute to the magnetic and electric dipole moments
of charged leptons, which the current experiments have measured with good
accuracy. We revisit the parameter spaces of TeV-scale vector LQs that
contribute to these observables and study how these models fare against the LHC
bounds. We find that only $U_1$ and $V_2$ can explain the observed positive
shift in $(a_\mu^{\rm exp} - a_\mu^{\rm SM})$ through a lepton
chirality-flipping contribution with $\mathcal O(1)$ LQ-quark-lepton coupling.
We also see how these two LQs can fit the electron dipole moment measurements.
